intro: Cupania voua-rana, commonly known as the Madagascar cupania, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
